member.name: IMFRateSupport.GetFastestRate
member.summary: Gets the fastest playback rate supported by the object.
member.param: Specifies whether to query to the fastest forward playback rate or reverse playback rate. The value is a member of the enumeration.
If TRUE, the method retrieves the fastest thinned playback rate. Otherwise, the method retrieves the fastest non-thinned playback rate. For information about thinning, see About Rate Control.
Receives the fastest playback rate that the object supports.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The object does not support reverse playback.
The object does not support thinning.

member.name: IMFRateSupport.GetSlowestRate
member.summary: Retrieves the slowest playback rate supported by the object.
member.param: Specifies whether to query to the slowest forward playback rate or reverse playback rate. The value is a member of the enumeration.
If TRUE, the method retrieves the slowest thinned playback rate. Otherwise, the method retrieves the slowest non-thinned playback rate. For information about thinning, see About Rate Control.
Receives the slowest playback rate that the object supports.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The object does not support reverse playback.
The object does not support thinning.

member.name: IMFRateSupport.IsRateSupported
member.summary: Queries whether the object supports a specified playback rate.
member.param: If TRUE, the method queries whether the object supports the playback rate with thinning. Otherwise, the method queries whether the object supports the playback rate without thinning. For information about thinning, see About Rate Control.

If the object does not support the playback rate given in flRate, this parameter receives the closest supported playback rate. If the method returns S_OK, this parameter receives the value given in flRate. This parameter can be NULL.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The object supports the specified rate.
The object does not support reverse playback.
The object does not support thinning.
The object does not support the specified rate.

summary.para: Queries the range of playback rates that are supported, including reverse playback.
To get a pointer to this interface, call with the service identifier MF_RATE_CONTROL_SERVICE.
